<meta itemprop="worstRating" content="0">
<meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5">
<meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4">

<span class="visually-hidden">3.0 stars</span>

<i class="icon sprite-icon star-icon"></i><i class="icon sprite-icon star-icon"></i><i class="icon sprite-icon star-icon"></i>
</li>


<li itemprop="servesCuisine">Italian</li>


<li itemprop="priceRange">$$$</li>


<li itemprop="addressLocality" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/PostalAddress">NoHo</li>

</ul>
<p class="summary" itemprop="description">
This sibling to the original Il Buco, on Bond Street, is the city’s most complete realization so far of a powerful myth: the simple and convivial restaurant that tastes just like Italy.
</p>

By
<span class="author-name">
Pete Wells

<h2 class="headline" itemprop="headline">
Kutsher's Tribeca
</h2>
<ul class="review-meta-menu">

<li class="critics-pick">
<i class="icon sprite-icon"></i>
<span class="critics-pick-label">NYT Critic’s Pick</span>
</li>

<meta itemprop="worstRating" content="0">
<meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5">
<meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3">

<span class="visually-hidden">1 star</span>

<i class="icon sprite-icon star-icon"></i>
</li>


<li itemprop="servesCuisine">Deli, Eastern European</li>


<li itemprop="priceRange">$$$</li>


<li itemprop="addressLocality" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/PostalAddress">TriBeCa</li>

</ul>
<p class="summary" itemprop="description">
Opened by a member of the family that owns a legendary, if faded, resort in the Catskills, Kutsher’s Tribeca turns all the old jokes about Jewish cooking upside-down.
</p>

By

Pete Wells
</span>

Parm
</h2>

<span class="critics-pick-label">NYT Critic’s Pick</span>

<meta itemprop="worstRating" content="0">
<meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5">

</li>

</ul>

<li id="story-id-1248069043150">
<article class="story theme-summary no-thumb" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Restaurant">
<div class="story-body">
<a class="story-link" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2012/01/18/dining/reviews/littleneck-and-sea-witch-nyc-restaurant-review.html?rref=collection%2Fcollection%2Frestaurant-guide">
<div class="story-meta">
<h2 class="headline" itemprop="headline">
Littleneck
</h2>
<ul class="review-meta-menu">

<li class="critics-pick">
<i class="icon sprite-icon"></i>
<span class="critics-pick-label">NYT Critic’s Pick</span>
</li>



<li itemprop="servesCuisine">Seafood</li>


<li itemprop="priceRange">$$</li>


<li itemprop="addressLocality" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/PostalAddress">Gowanus</li>

</ul>
<p class="summary" itemprop="description">
This cute, shipshape seafood shack near Brooklyn’s Gowanus Canal serves clams raw, steamed, in a chowder, and in a roll, sometimes to tasty effect. 
</p>

<p class="byline" itemprop="author">
By
<span class="author-name">
Betsy Andrews
</span>
</p>

</div><!-- close story-meta -->

</a>
</div><!-- close story-body -->
<footer class="story-footer">

<a class="story-link" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/28/dining/reviews/miss-lilys-and-coppelia-nyc-restaurant-review.html?rref=collection%2Fcollection%2Frestaurant-guide">
<div class="story-meta">
<h2 class="headline" itemprop="headline">
Coppelia
</h2>
<ul class="review-meta-menu">

<li class="critics-pick">
<i class="icon sprite-icon"></i>
<span class="critics-pick-label">NYT Critic’s Pick</span>
</li>


<li class="critic-star-rating" itemprop="reviewRating" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating">
<meta itemprop="worstRating" content="0">
<meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5">
<meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3">

<span class="visually-hidden">1 star</span>

<i class="icon sprite-icon star-icon"></i>
</li>


<li itemprop="servesCuisine">Caribbean, Latin, Latin American</li>


<li itemprop="priceRange">$$</li>


<li itemprop="addressLocality" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/PostalAddress">Chelsea</li>

</ul>
<p class="summary" itemprop="description">
This self-styled 24-hour Cuban luncheonette serves a wide-ranging menu of Latino food from across the Caribbean and into South America.
</p>

<p class="byline" itemprop="author">
By
<span class="author-name">
Sam Sifton
</span>
</p>

</div><!-- close story-meta -->

</a>

</h2>

<meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5">

<span class="visually-hidden">1 star</span>

<i class="icon sprite-icon star-icon"></i>
</li>


<li itemprop="servesCuisine">American, Steak Houses</li>


<li itemprop="priceRange">$$$</li>


<li itemprop="addressLocality" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/PostalAddress">Williamsburg</li>

</ul>
<p class="summary" itemprop="description">

Danji
</h2>
<ul class="review-meta-menu">

<li class="critics-pick">
<i class="icon sprite-icon"></i>
<span class="critics-pick-label">NYT Critic’s Pick</span>
</li>

<meta itemprop="worstRating" content="0">
<meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5">
<meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3">

<span class="visually-hidden">1 star</span>

<i class="icon sprite-icon star-icon"></i>
</li>


<li itemprop="servesCuisine">Korean</li>


<li itemprop="priceRange">$$$</li>


<li itemprop="addressLocality" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/PostalAddress">Clinton</li>

</ul>
<p class="summary" itemprop="description">
A new-style Korean take on a Japanese izakaya.
</p>

<p class="byline" itemprop="author">
By
<span class="author-name">
Sam Sifton
</span>
</p>

</ul>
<p class="summary" itemprop="description">

</p>

By

Sam Sifton
</span>

<div class="story-body">
<a class="story-link" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/08/10/dining/reviews/uncle-zhou-in-queens-nyc-restaurant-review.html?rref=collection%2Fcollection%2Frestaurant-guide">
<div class="story-meta">
<h2 class="headline" itemprop="headline">
Uncle Zhou
</h2>
<ul class="review-meta-menu">

<li class="critics-pick">
<i class="icon sprite-icon"></i>
<span class="critics-pick-label">NYT Critic’s Pick</span>
</li>



<li itemprop="servesCuisine">Chinese</li>


<li itemprop="priceRange">$$</li>


<li itemprop="addressLocality" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/PostalAddress">Elmhurst</li>

</ul>
<p class="summary" itemprop="description">
Uncle Zhou serves homey food from Henan province, where wheat noodles are the foundation of many meals.

</p>

<p class="byline" itemprop="author">
By
<span class="author-name">
Dave Cook
</span>
</p>

<article class="story theme-summary " itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Restaurant">
<div class="story-body">
<a class="story-link" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/08/03/dining/reviews/leopard-at-des-artistes-nyc-restaurant-review.html?rref=collection%2Fcollection%2Frestaurant-guide">
<div class="story-meta">
<h2 class="headline" itemprop="headline">
The Leopard at Des Artistes 
</h2>
<ul class="review-meta-menu">

<li class="critics-pick">
<i class="icon sprite-icon"></i>
<span class="critics-pick-label">NYT Critic’s Pick</span>
</li>


<li class="critic-star-rating" itemprop="reviewRating" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating">
<meta itemprop="worstRating" content="0">
<meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5">
<meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3.5">

<span class="visually-hidden">2.0 stars</span>

<i class="icon sprite-icon star-icon"></i><i class="icon sprite-icon star-icon"></i>
</li>


<li itemprop="servesCuisine">Italian</li>


<li itemprop="priceRange">$$$$</li>


<li itemprop="addressLocality" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/PostalAddress">Upper West Side</li>

</ul>
<p class="summary" itemprop="description">
Gianfranco Sorrentino and Paula Sorrentino transformed the old Café Des Artistes space into an airy and cheerful southern Italian clubhouse.
</p>

<p class="byline" itemprop="author">
By
<span class="author-name">
Sam Sifton
</span>
</p>

</div><!-- close story-meta -->

<li id="story-id-1248069043015">
<article class="story theme-summary no-thumb" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Restaurant">
<div class="story-body">
<a class="story-link" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/07/27/dining/reviews/legend-bar-and-restaurant-nyc-restaurant-review.html?rref=collection%2Fcollection%2Frestaurant-guide">
<div class="story-meta">
<h2 class="headline" itemprop="headline">
Legend Bar and Restaurant
</h2>
<ul class="review-meta-menu">

<li class="critics-pick">
<i class="icon sprite-icon"></i>
<span class="critics-pick-label">NYT Critic’s Pick</span>
</li>



<li itemprop="servesCuisine">Chinese</li>


<li itemprop="priceRange">$$</li>


<li itemprop="addressLocality" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/PostalAddress">Chelsea</li>

</ul>
<p class="summary" itemprop="description">
At this spiffed-up Sichuan restaurant, the chef Ging Den Wang explores traditional dishes and his own variations, most of them expertly made and highly spiced.
</p>

<p class="byline" itemprop="author">
By
<span class="author-name">
Julia Moskin
</span>
</p>

</div><!-- close story-meta -->
